descript.abstract: World Administrative Units 2002 is a polygon theme representing the boundaries for the first-level administrative units of the world, as they existed in 2002.
descript.purpose: World Administrative Units 2002 provides first-level administrative unit boundaries for the world in 2002.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:15,000,000.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.1.3.679

dataqual.logic: No duplicate features are present. The shapefile is created directly from a topologically correct ArcInfo? coverage.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from the ArcWorld Supplement database and then generalized (tolerance unknown). The positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.origin: International Border Treaty between the Republic of Yemen and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
citeinfo.title: THE TREATY OF JEDDAH, 2000

procstep.procdesc:
The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Updated Saudi Arabia - Yemen border. Updated attributes for East Timor, Yugoslavia, Saudi Arabia, and Yemen. Recalculated attributes based on area. Created ArcGIS? layer file (.lyr) and ArcView legend file (.avl). Copied projection file (.prj) and created spatial indices.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the features from ESRI Data & Maps 1999 data set?admin98.shp. Updated political boundaries for countries and first-level administrative units. This included Nunavut in Canada and Macau in China as well as others. Extended political boundaries into the Caspian Sea and removed the shoreline. Created ArcGIS? layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Created spatial indices.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the boundaries for the first-level administrative units of the world, as they existed in 2002.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-letter country code, two-number administrative unit code) for the administrative unit.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The administrative unit code (three-letter country code, three-letter administrative unit code) for the administrative unit.
The name of the administrative unit.
The FIPS code (two-letter) for the country in which the administrative unit is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The country code (three-letter) for the country in which the administrative unit is located.
The name for the country in which the administrative unit is located.
attr.attrdefs: ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook

attr.attrdef: The 1994 estimated population of the administrative unit.
attr.attrdefs: National Center for Geographic Information and Analysis

edom.edomvds: ESRI

attr.attrdef: The English name for the type of administrative unit.
attr.attrdefs: ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook, Nunavut Planning Commission (NPC), Global Mapping International

edom.edomv: Administrative Region, Administrative Subdivision, Area, Autonomous Community, Autonomous Municipality, Autonomous Region, Canton, Capital City, Capital Municipality, Capital Territory, City, Constitutional Province, County, Department, District, Division, Economic Prefecture, Emirate, Federal Dependencies, Federal District, Federal Status City, Federal Territory, Governorate, Independent Town, Intendancy, Municipality, National District, National Territory, Pakistan-administered, Parish, Prefecture, Province, Region, Republic, Special City, Special District, Special Municipality, Special Region, State, Territory, Town, Union Territory, Zone
edom.edomvds: ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook, Nunavut Planning Commission (NPC), Global Mapping International

attr.attrdef: The local name for the type of administrative unit.
attr.attrdefs: ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook, Nunavut Planning Commission (NPC), Global Mapping International

attr.attrdef: The administrative unit area in square kilometers using an equal area projection.
The administrative unit area in square miles using an equal area projection.
The number allows the administrative unit to be shaded unique from its neighbors.
